title: 111_s3612
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Marsh-Billings-Rockefeller National Historical Park Establishment Amendments Act of 2010". Boundary expansion is addressed in the Act. The Marsh-Billings-Rockefeller National Historical Park boundaries are amended to include a historic zone with the mansion and Mt. Tom area, and a protection zone with the Billings Farm and Museum. The Marsh-Billings-Rockefeller National Historical Park boundaries are amended to include the King Farm in Woodstock, Vermont, comprising approximately 159 acres. The Secretary will prepare a revised map reflecting this inclusion for public inspection. The boundaries of the Marsh-Billings-Rockefeller National Historical Park are expanded to include the King Farm in Woodstock, Vermont, totaling 159 acres. The Secretary will create a new map to show this addition for public viewing. Section 4 of the Marsh-Billings-Rockefeller National Historical Park Establishment Act is amended to allow the Secretary to acquire land within the park through various means, with an exception for land owned by the State of Vermont or its political subdivisions. Commercial operations within the park are also permitted. The Secretary may acquire land for King Farm within the park for agricultural, forestry, and conservation purposes, emphasizing preservation of existing open fields. The Secretary may enter into leases, repair buildings, and construct new structures on acquired land for educational purposes related to agriculture, forestry, and conservation activities within the park. The Secretary can construct new buildings on acquired land for agricultural purposes if deemed necessary and consistent with existing agricultural buildings. SEC. 4. COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS.

The Secretary may enter into cooperative agreements with individuals or entities for the benefit of park programs, including rehabilitation, recreation, research, and education.

SEC. 5. ENDOWMENT; DONATIONS; CONSERVATION STUDY INSTITUTE.

Establishes provisions for endowment, donations, and the Conservation Study Institute. The Secretary may receive and expend funds from endowments established with the Woodstock Foundation and the Vermont Land Trust for designated uses in consultation with the Secretary. The Secretary, in consultation with the Secretary, may designate funds for the preservation and maintenance of specific properties and programs. Donations of funds, property, or services can be accepted by the Secretary to carry out this Act. The Secretary, in collaboration with the University of Vermont, may establish a National Park Service Conservation Study Institute at the park to identify and share innovation in conservation practices. SEC. 6. MANAGEMENT PLAN. Amendment to the Marsh-Billings-Rockefeller National Historical Park Establishment Act requires the Secretary to submit a revised general management plan for the park within 3 fiscal years of enactment.
